It sounds like under that scheme the worst individuals have the same 
chance of reproducing as the best?  That does sound like it 
preserves diversity but it has almost no convergence.  Perhaps if 
you want diversity a roulette wheel method would be better.

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Tyler Streeter <tylerstreeter@y...> 
wrote:
> I just read a paper called "Fitness Uniform Selection
> to Preserve Genetic Diversity" by Marcus Hutter. 
> Here's a link:
> 
> www.idsia.ch/~marcus/ai/pfuss.pdf
> 
> He describes a selection method that keeps the
> population from converging on any optima.  Here's how
> the selection algorithm works:
> 
> 1. Pick a uniform random number between the min and
> max population fitness.
> 
> 2. Select the individual in the population with
> fitness closest to the random number; use this
> individual to reproduce.
> 
> Of course NEAT already has a method to keep the
> population diverse, but in my domain I still usually
> have a bunch of species all converged on different
> local optima.  I'm experimenting with using this
> selection method in combination with NEAT.
> 
> Does anyone have any thoughts on this selection
> method?
> 
> Tyler
>
